title: Speed of ball when it reaches the ground

content.description: A student wants to investigate the motion of a ball by conducting two different experiments, as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2 above. In Experiment 1, the student releases a ball from rest and uses a slow-motion camera to film the ball as it falls to the ground. Using video analysis, the student is able to plot the ball’s horizontal position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and vertical position <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. In Experiment 2, the student horizontally rolls the same ball off a table, and uses video analysis to plot the ball’s horizontal position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and vertical position <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> starting from the instant the ball leaves the table. The graphs from each experiment are shown above along with each graph’s best-fit curve line.
content.question: In Experiment 1, what is the speed of the ball the instant it makes contact with the ground?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.55 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.55</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5.4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5.4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
